Instruction: Wash both eggplants and make several piercings in them with a knife. Arrange the eggplants on a cookie sheet and place them in a preheated oven at 500 degrees F (260 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes. Once the eggplants are baked and cooled, remove the skin and transfer the flesh into a mixing bowl.

Add lemon juice, salt, olive oil, and plain yogurt to the bowl. Combine the ingredients until smooth. Incorporate tahini to your preference. Once all ingredients are mixed, transfer the dip to a serving bowl. Mix in teriyaki sauce and garlic, then refrigerate until ready to serve.
